interpretation:
The Japanese symbol for beginner represents a new start, a fresh beginning in life. It signifies the start of a new journey, an opportunity to learn and grow. This card is a reminder to embrace your innocence and inexperience, and to not be afraid to venture into the unknown. It encourages you to take risks, to explore new paths and to try new things. The Japanese symbol for beginner reminds you that everyone starts somewhere, and that it is okay to not have all the answers right away. It is a card of hope, optimism and a symbol of the endless possibilities that come with starting fresh.

In a reading, this card may suggest a new opportunity or a new project, a new relationship or a new perspective on life. It may also indicate a need for patience and perseverance as you navigate uncharted waters. Embrace your inner beginner, and allow yourself to learn and grow. The Japanese symbol for beginner reminds you that every journey starts with a single step, and that the journey itself is often more rewarding than the destination.
